question: What is the maximum mortgage I can afford with an annual income of $80,000 and monthly debts of $1,000?
true_answer: With an annual income of $80,000 and debts of $1,000 per month, you can afford a maximum mortgage of approximately $320,000.

steps.content: What is the maximum mortgage I can afford with an annual income of $80,000 and monthly debts of $1,000?
Plan: 1) Retrieve mortgage affordability criteria. 2) Calculate DTI. 3) Estimate maximum mortgage. 4) Confirm with supervisor. 5) Provide final answer.
Retrieving knowledge on mortgage affordability criteria.
Mortgage typically affordable if DTI is below 36%.
Calculating monthly income and DTI for $1,000 debts.
Monthly income is $6,667; monthly debt-to-income calculated as 15%.
Estimating maximum mortgage based on income and DTI.
Does this include property taxes and insurance?
Estimates typically include only principal and interest. Taxes and insurance are additional.
With an annual income of $80,000 and debts of $1,000 per month, you can afford a maximum mortgage of approximately $320,000. Note that property taxes and insurance are not included in this estimate.
